subject: Gardening
title: Explosive Dispersal: Seeds That Launch
description: A 60-second lesson on Explosive Dispersal: Seeds That Launch.

hook.text: The sandbox tree fires seeds at 160 miles per hour. It's called the 'dynamite tree' for good reason.

buildup.text: Explosive dispersal uses mechanical tension. Seed pods dry unevenly, building pressure until they violently split open.

discovery.text: Touch-me-not (Impatiens) pods explode at the slightest touch, flinging seeds up to 20 feet from the parent plant.

twist.text: Dwarf mistletoe seeds are fired at 60 mph with enough force to stick to tree barkâ€”targeted botanical artillery.

climax.text: Explosive dispersal converts chemical energy into kinetic energyâ€”seeds are nature's self-propelled projectiles.

punchline.text: Some seeds launch themselves at 160 mph. Nature invented guns.

quiz.question: How fast can sandbox tree seeds be ejected?
